Html:
Hello,
Im looking for a way to see the files name/ path I used for creating the update.
If I create a new update, the first windows ask for ..file an ..more Files / folders.
If I reopen the update configuration later, I start on the second window (Vendor / Product name .... )
But time to time, if I searching for problems, eg. with modified .msi's, I want to check used file name / creating date.

request:
Yes, I can got to /WSUS/UpdateServicesPackages/ and searching, but Its not very comfortable, starting on the first Window, eg with greyed path names will be helpfull.

Hello, run WPP and connect to your wsus server. Then select the update and on the 'Information' tab click on the 'Id' Guid. This will open the right folder.
Note that you won't be able to change files here. Wsus will not let you do. You will need to make a new update to change these files. This is why when you revise an update, you start with the second screen.
